page.title: 04THE CHURCH IN CUCKFIELD
page.content: Cuckfield Church, built 1245, is one of the most interesting historical buildings in the village. The first vicar, Walter De Warnecamp, was appointed in 1252 and the present vicar, Eric Hayden was appointed in 1978. Inside the church are many monuments to famous and rich Cuckfield people of the past. There are 13 monuments to members of the Burrell family (Iron Industry 16th to 18th Centuries),& monuments to the Sergison family (owners until recently of Cuckfield Park). Also in the church is the earliest remaining record of births, marriages and deaths, 1598. 1981 church spire destroyed by fire. The people of Cuckfield rallied together and a new spire has now been built. The church continues to be a focal point in the village and to play and important part in community life.
